event.title: was shown as Longchimney on the first edition Ordnance Survey map of 1897

data.event: The name of this was shown as Longchimney on the first edition Ordnance Survey map of 1897, and then as Clifton Dikes on the later second edition.

event.title: a resistance against Roman forces in 69 A.D.

data.event: Clifton Dykes has been suggested as the (pre-Roman conquest) centre of the Carvetti, an Iron Age and Roman-period 'tribe', one that possibly led a resistance against Roman forces in 69 A.D. under the leadership of Venutius.
